reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Sun Mountain Lodge is a year-round resort, however it is a particularly wonderful winter destination thanks to the ski trails, snow shoe trails and other winter fun (e.g. sleigh rides) The Sun Mountain spa has a great selection of services and a calming ambiance. The food in The Dining Room is expensive so make dinner the main event of an evening, or go to the Restaurant for breakfast when the valley view can be enjoyed.
reviews.title: Winter wonderland

reviews.text: I've stay at Sun Mountain lodge for many years and it is consistently excellent. comfortable accomodations, attentative and genuine staff, and a terrific location. I think it's a great value except for the food. Bar and resturant food is average to good, not outstanding as one would expect from a hotel like this. Still worth a visit
reviews.title: sun mountain lodge is consistently terrific

reviews.text: Stayed there for the second time with my family. Staff was very friendly and helpful. We forgot a few items when we left and the hotel mailed them to us free of charge. Clearly superb customer service. Many types of outdoor activities are just outside the front door - cross-country skiing and showshoeing in the winter and hiking in the summer. We had breakfast in the dining room each day and occasional dinners at the bar. No complains about food. Coffee was excellent as they use local Blue Star Coffee. Definitely planning to stay there again and would recommend this property to anyone, especially families.
reviews.title: Great place to stay in awesome location

reviews.text: Staff was welcoming, helpful, more than pleasant, professional. It is a pricey place to stay but the views were stunning and the lodge rooms lovely. Great for a special occasions. I would go back and recommend.

reviews.text: My family and I very much enjoyed the too-brief stay we had at Sun Mountain Lodge in mid-June 2013. The lodge is quite remote, but the roads were well maintained and easy to drive. We found the two-bedroom Mt. Robinson Suite we needed to accommodate our party to be spacious, clean, well-appointed and -maintained, and quite comfortable (except for the sleeper sofa, which my son found uncomfortable; suggestion: use a memory foam mattress, which at The Maxwell Hotel in Seattle he declared to be the most comfortable sleeper sofa we had ever consigned him to). The views from the room and other sites about the lodge were terrific. The amenities in the lodge were very nice, and there's no shortage of nature-related activities. Did not have a chance to use the spa or the stable, but pricing seemed reasonable. No TVs in the rooms (though one of the commons rooms in the lodge had one), but WiFi service was quite good. Unsurprisingly, cellphone connectivity was borderline. At breakfast the first morning, the food (at prices you'd expect for an upscale hotel in a remote location) was decent but otherwise unmemorable, and service was pleasant but slow (not that we were in a rush); all in all, we were not impressed enough to eat dinner there (despite the four-diamond AAA rating) and instead had decent dinners one night at the Twisp River Pub in Twisp about 15 miles away and the next night at The Breadline Café in Omak, about an hour away. (The drives were beautiful, but of course there's no drive in the Cascades that's not beautiful.) The lodge very kindly accommodated our need for an early departure the following morning and had packed continental breakfasts waiting for us at the front desk. We found all of the staff to be very pleasant and helpful. At the substantially discounted price I was able to negotiate for the suite and breakfast (after finding erroneously low prices on their website), we felt the value to be reasonable, but I doubt we would have stayed there at the (correct) posted price. The night clerk told me the lodge has been owned by a German family for about 20-25 years. It was evident to me that their attention to excellence at this property is such that I would certainly consider staying at their properties in Germany and the Caribbean.
reviews.title: Outstanding mountain resort

reviews.text: We thoroughly enjoyed this lovely place. Our suite in Robinson literally took our breath away. It was beautifully decorated and completely peaceful and luxurious. We had great meals, fantastic views of the Methow Valley, and hike after hike through the wildflowers. Exactly what we were looking for!
reviews.title: Loved It!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have been going to Sun Mountain Lodge for 25 years and find it a wonderful place. When we visited in May 2013 we hiked the lovely hills, and enjoyed a local rodeo, among other things. Everything is perfectly kept up and we feel it is the perfect place for a retreat to the beautiful hills of Winthrop. Since dinner in the dining room is pricey and limited in choices, we usually end up in the bar which has an extensive menu. Children are welcome and their children's menu is great.
reviews.title: Sun Mountain Lodge
Sun Mountain resort for scenery and activities, but not so much for food
reviews.text: Sun Mountain has a wonderful location and fine rooms, with stunning views of the Cascade Mountains to the west of the lodge and other buildings. It also has a broad choice of activities and hiking in the nearby hills and mountains. I have spent several days there on two occasions over the last month (May 2013). My only reservation concerns the dining room, which served us a mediocre salmon (Atlantic farmed salmon going under the guise of "Tasmanian" salmon) meal. On the other hand, breakfasts were included in the room charge, and were excellent. The bar menu, plus the stunning vista from the bar, was good. It's a great place for a getaway, and you get away from TV (at last!). The staff is friendly and helpful.
